briefTitle: A Trial of Cranberry Capsules for Urinary Tract Infection Prevention in Nursing Home Residents

outcomeMeasures.title: Participants With Urine Cultures With Bacteriuria (>100,000 Cfu/ml or >=100,000 Cfu/ml) Plus Pyuria (Any WBC)
outcomeMeasures.description: Clean catch urine cultures and urinalyses will be obtained every two months for each participant for study purposes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Episodes of Symptomatic UTI
outcomeMeasures.description: Suspected UTI episodes that are recorded in the medical record by the primary provider will be reviewed by chart review, symptoms will be recorded, and two adjudicators will determine if the definition of symptomatic UTI is met.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Antibiotic Prescriptions
outcomeMeasures.description: Chart review will be performed to determine the names and duration of antibiotic prescriptions prescribed by the primary provider on each participant.

outcomeMeasures.title: Bacteriuria With Multidrug-resistant Gram-negative Bacilli
outcomeMeasures.description: All urine culture data will be reviewed to determine presence of multidrug-resistant gram-negative bacilli (resistance to ≥3 of the following antibiotics: ampicillinsulbactam,cefazolin, ceftriaxone, ceftazidime, fluoroquinolones, piperacillin-tazobactam, meropenem, imipenem, and trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole).

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Antibiotic Prescriptions for Suspected UTI
outcomeMeasures.description: Chart review will be performed to determine the names and duration of antibiotic prescriptions prescribed by the primary provider on each participant's suspected UTI.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Adverse Events in Participants
Adherence to Capsule Intake by All Participants
outcomeMeasures.description: measured by capsules removed from blister packs

outcomeMeasures.title: Subjects With 1, 2, or 3 Episodes of UTIs
outcomeMeasures.description: Suspected UTI episodes that are recorded in the medical record by the primary provider will be reviewed by chart review, symptoms will be recorded, and two adjudicators will determine if the definition of symptomatic UTI is met.
